items.content:
38: :label: lem-wasserstein-entropy
39: 
40: Under the N-uniform LSI ({prf:ref}`thm-kl-convergence-euclidean` from [09_kl_convergence](09_kl_convergence)), the 2-Wasserstein distance between $\nu_N^{QSD}$ (the N-particle quasi-stationary distribution) and $\rho_0^{\otimes N}$ (the product of mean-field invariant measures) satisfies:
41: 
42: $$

44: $$

items.label: lem-quantitative-kl-bound
items.title: Quantitative KL Bound
items.content:
175: :label: lem-quantitative-kl-bound
176: 
177: Let $\mathcal{H}_N := D_{KL}(\nu_N^{QSD} \| \rho_0^{\otimes N})$ be the relative entropy between the N-particle QSD and the product of mean-field measures. Under the cloning mechanism with rate $\lambda$ and the N-uniform LSI, we have:
178: 
179: $$
180: \mathcal{H}_N \leq \frac{C_{\text{int}}}{N}
181: $$
182: 
183: where $C_{\text{int}}$ is the **interaction complexity constant**, which quantifies the strength of particle interactions through the diversity companion probability.
184: 
185: **Explicit form:**
186: 
187: $$
188: C_{\text{int}} := \sup_{Z \in \Omega^N} \left\{ \sum_{i=1}^N \left| \mathbb{E}_{j \sim P_{\text{comp}}^i(Z)} [\Phi_j - \Phi_i] \right| \right\}
189: $$

items.label: lem-lipschitz-observable-error
items.title: Empirical Measure Observable Error
items.content:
349: :label: lem-lipschitz-observable-error
350: 
351: For any Lipschitz observable $\phi: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}$ with constant $L_\phi$, the expected Wasserstein distance between the empirical measure and the target measure controls the observable error:
352: 
353: $$
354: \left| \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \phi(z_i) \right] - \int_\Omega \phi(z) \rho_0(z) dz \right| \leq L_\phi \cdot \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ W_1(\bar{\mu}_N, \rho_0) \right]
355: $$
356: 
357: where $\bar{\mu}_N = \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N \delta_{z_i}$ is the empirical measure.
358: 
359: Furthermore:
360: 
361: $$
362: \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ W_1(\bar{\mu}_N, \rho_0) \right] \leq \sqrt{\mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ W_2^2(\bar{\mu}_N, \rho_0) \right]} \leq C_W \cdot \frac{1}{\sqrt{N}}
363: $$

items.label: lem-baoab-invariant-measure-error
items.title: BAOAB Invariant Measure Error
items.content:
1209: :label: lem-baoab-invariant-measure-error
1210: 
1211: Let $\nu^{\text{cont}}$ be the invariant measure of the continuous-time Langevin dynamics and let $\nu^{\Delta t}$ be the invariant measure of the BAOAB chain with step size $\Delta t$. For any observable $\phi \in C^4$ with $\|\phi\|_{C^4} < \infty$:
1212: 
1213: $$
1214: \left| \mathbb{E}_{\nu^{\Delta t}} [\phi] - \mathbb{E}_{\nu^{\text{cont}}} [\phi] \right| \leq C_{\text{inv}} \cdot \|\phi\|_{C^4} \cdot (\Delta t)^2
1215: $$
1216: 
1217: where $C_{\text{inv}}$ depends on $\gamma, \sigma, \|\nabla U\|_{\text{Lip}}, M_4, \kappa_{\text{mix}}$ but not on $\Delta t$.

items.label: lem-uniform-geometric-ergodicity
items.title: Uniform Geometric Ergodicity
items.content:
1829: :label: lem-uniform-geometric-ergodicity
1830: 
1831: Under the confinement axiom, there exist constants $\kappa_{\text{mix}} > 0$ and $C_{\text{erg}} < \infty$ such that for all $\Delta t < \Delta t_0$, the discrete-time Markov chain with transition kernel $\mathcal{T}^{\Delta t}$ satisfies:
1832: 
1833: $$
1834: \left\|\mathcal{P}_k - \nu_N^{\text{discrete}}\right\|_{\text{TV}} \leq C_{\text{erg}} e^{-\kappa_{\text{mix}} k \Delta t}
1835: $$
1836: 
1837: where $\mathcal{P}_k$ is the distribution after $k$ steps starting from an arbitrary initial condition with finite fourth moment.
